intro: Pedicularis amoena var. elatior, commonly known as the greater yellow monkeyflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its lance-shaped leaves are arranged oppositely along the stem, and the flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the branches. This species is notable for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant, showy blooms.
